license.license-p: This is an open-access article distributed under the terms of the Creative Commons Attribution License, which permits unrestricted use, distribution, and reproduction in any medium, provided the original work is properly cited. The citation of this article must include: the name(s) of the authors, the name of the journal, the full URL of the article (in a hyperlinked format if distributed online) and the DOI number of the article.

abstract.p: This is a sample abstract that forms part of the metadataSample.xml file in meTypeset.

sec.title: subtitle subtitle
sec.p: Martin Eve; Author

sec.title: Preface
sec.p: Optional: If you do not include a Preface, delete the entire page. Do not delete the section break below. It is needed to initiate the printing of page numbers from the Acknowledgements page on.

sec.title: Acknowledgements
sec.p: Optional: if Acknowledgements page is not used, delete entire page, including the following page break. Do not delete the section break above. It is needed to initiate the printing of page numbers from this page on.

sec.title: Abstract
sec.p: Hidden text: The abstract may be included at the discretion of the supervisor.
Abstract: May not exceed 350 words. It should be a concise statement of the nature and content of the thesis or report.

HIDDENT TEXT: If you choose to place the chapter number (“Chapter 1”) and the chapter title (“Introduction”) on different lines, the automatically generated table of contents will reflect that format. After creating a new table of contents, set them on the same line by deleting the page number and paragraph marker at the end of each chapter number line.

sec.title: Table of Contents
sec.p: TOC Preface 2
Acknowledgements 3
Abstract 4
Table of Contents 5
Major Section: heading 1,h1 1
Chapter n: Chapter Title:Heading 2,h2 1
Heading 3,h3 1
Heading 4,h4 1
Heading 5,h5 1
Appendix 6
Glossary 7
References 8
Vita
Major Section: heading 1,h1
Using Major Sections is optional. If your thesis is not divided into major sections, then you do not need use the style “HEADING 1,H1”; start chapters using “Heading 2,h2.”
Chapter n: Chapter Title:Heading 2,h2
Body text to begin here. (Campbell, 1999) parenthetical references.
HIDDEN TEXT: The following sample text and headings are for information only. Delete them after browsing.
Text,t: The first line of each paragraph is indented one-half inch, as shown, and the lines are justified, i.e., the right margin is even rather than ragged.

Paragraphs with the styles Heading 1,h1 or Heading 2,h2 applied can be extracted to appear in the table of contents with styles TOC 1 or TOC 2 respectively. Major Section: Heading 1,h1 is an optional heading. Delete the entire paragraph if you do not use it.

sec.title: Heading 3,h3
sec.p: Paragraphs with the style Heading 3,h3 applied can be extracted to appear in the table of contents with the style TOC 3.

sec.title: Heading 4,h4
sec.p: Paragraphs with the style Heading 4,h4 applied can be extracted to appear in the table of contents with the style TOC 4.

sec.title: Heading 5,h5
sec.p: Paragraphs with the style Heading 5,h5 applied can be extracted to appear in the table of contents with the style TOC 5.

table-wrap.label: Paragraphs with the style Heading 7,h7 applied can be extracted to appear in the list of tables with the style TOC 7

caption.p: Style Heading 7,h7 is used for naming tables, for example:

sec.p: Paragraphs with the style Heading 8,h8 applied can be extracted to appear in the list of figures with the style TOC 8. Style Heading 8,h8 is used for naming figures, for example:

Paragraphs with the style Heading 9,h9 applied can be extracted to appear in the list of illustrations with the style TOC 9
Example of Heading 8,h8 format.
Style Heading 9,h9 is used for naming illustrations ( see sample below the following graphic)Figure 1: Example of Heading 8,h8 format.

Left margin graphic,lg: for formatting and positioning graphic images such as figures and illustrations on the page. The sample graphic shown below is formatted using the style left margin graphic,lg. It is aligned left and has 12-point spacing preceding the image. Immediately following the graphic is a paragraph with the style Heading 9,h9 applied.

Table 1
Example of Heading 9,h9 format.
Example of Heading 7,h7 format.Illustration 1: Example of Heading 9,h9 format.
text hanging indent,th: The paragraph is indented one-half inch to the right after the first line, as shown. Apply text hanging indent style to bullet points or lists. See examples below.
Highlight text and click the Bullets button on the Formatting toolbar.

sec.title: Highlight text and click the Numbering button on the Formatting toolbar. Note that bullets and numbering can be toggled on and off.
sec.p: text indent,ti: The left margin of this paragraph is set in one-half inch, as shown. Apply text indent style to paragraphs nested within listed items.
text no indent,tn: The first line of this paragraph is not indented. Use this style for descriptive legends, facing caption page numbers, or any text in which the first line should not be indented.

text quote,tq: for prose quotation over three lines. This text is indented on the left. Do not use quotation marks if the quotation is indented except for quotations nested within the block quote. The first line of a block quote is not indented.
Block quotes are single-spaced, with a one-line space between paragraphs, as illustrated.

reference,ref: The paragraph is indented one-half inch to the right after the first line. It is single-spaced between lines and double-spaced between paragraphs. Apply reference style to bibliography and references listings.

Normal,n: This is the parent style on which all but one template styles are based. Changes made to this style will affect all the other styles except the style hidden text,hid., which is defined independent of Normal,n. For example, if you change the typeface from Times to Helvetica in the style Normal, all of the styles in this file will be changed to Helvetica (except any style you may create which has an explicitly different typeface specified, even when it is based on Normal,n).

sec.title: Appendix
sec.p: HIDDEN TEXT: NOTE: If you have more than one appendix you can use the Heading 2,h2 style and label each appendix separately, e.g., Appendix A, Appendix B, etc. You could also title this section “Appendices” using the Heading 2, h2 style, and use Heading 3,h3 for each separate appendix
This page is optional—must be placed in this order if it is included in the thesis. If you don’t want to include an appendix, then delete the entire page and the following page break.

sec.title: Glossary
sec.p: This page is optional—must be placed in this order if it is included in the thesis. If you don’t want to include a glossary, then delete the entire page and the following page break.

sec.title: Vita
sec.p: This page is optional: if you do not include a Vita, delete this entire page. The vita is a brief biographical sketch of the writer that provides information for future readers. It should include the writer's full name and a permanent address or e-mail address where he or she can be reached. Because the thesis/report will be available electronically, be aware that certain personal information could be used to steal your identity. For this reason, you are advised not to include your date of birth, parents’ names, or children’s names. The name of the typist should always appear at the end of the page.
Permanent address (or email): nn Street Name, City, State Zip
This thesis (report) was typed by the author, or typist's name.

ref.mixed-citation: Campbell, W. G. 1990. Form and Style in Thesis Writing, a Manual of Style. Chicago: The University of Chicago Press.
Turabian, K. L. 1987. A Manual for Writers of Term Papers, Theses, and Dissertations. 5th ed. Chicago: The University of Chicago Press.
